meanings.definition: Agitated or excited, especially in music.
meanings.sent1: The agitato music made me feel restless and jumpy.
meanings.sent2: The agitato melody quickened my heartbeat with its lively rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The agitato tune seemed to dance around the room, infecting everyone with energy.
meanings.sent4: Her agitato performance on the piano was like a storm brewing in the music hall.
meanings.sent5: The agitato notes painted a vivid picture of a bustling city in my mind.

meanings.definition: A tempo marking indicating a fast and agitated pace.
meanings.sent1: The piece was marked with agitato, signaling a rapid and turbulent tempo.
meanings.sent2: The conductor's baton moved swiftly to match the agitato tempo of the music.
meanings.sent3: The agitato tempo felt like a race against time, urging the musicians to keep up.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the agitato section, the music seemed to leap off the page.
meanings.sent5: The agitato pace of the music was like a whirlwind, sweeping the audience along.
